content.description: She’s stout. The crux is the first 25ft of climbing which features an odd assortment of jams, side pulls and face holds. It remains somewhat juggy to the top out. An extra number 3 or 4 might be nice but a single set of cams is all I usually take.
content.location: This is the third main diagonal crack and is fairly overhung.

content.description: A pumpy 5.9 through interesting wavy rock.
content.location: To the right of electric ave and yo mama’s a rasta

content.description:
A very tall start with Bouldery moves, some dirtyness and a sketch fake that you must trust completely, and you still have to go another 6ft to the first piece of gear. The start is intimidating for sure.  A lovely roof crux is next and continued climbing in the diagonal crack.  At the top I recommend leaving the crack and trending left up through the face with pretty good holds and gear.

Expect the grade to go up significantly when the flake breaks

Walk off or rap off
content.location: This is the climb directly over the fire ring/large bivy cave

content.description: This is the first major crack in this wall the start is often dirty and first placement is high. But the crack up high is very nice. Tops out to a pine tree. Rap or walk off
content.location: The first large crack feature on the reggae wall
